page.title: 19Gravel Extraction
page.content: The major economic activity of extracting gravel has been present in this area since the Second World War. There are a number of companies at work in the area, including R.M.C., Greenhams and Halls Aggregates. Present consumption trends are escalating so future use of the river terrace gravels will increase. The rights to extract gravel from Abbey Meads have recently revived local opposition and concern from the Thames Water Authority, who control local water supplies. The landscape changes dramatically once extraction starts, leaving many water-filled pits on exhaustion of the gravel. These are used as leisure centres for water sports, sailing and fishing, and are water-bird sanctuaries.
